metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33623 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The trim-newlines package before 3.0.1 and 4.x before 4.0.1 for Node.js has an issue related to regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) for the .end() method.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33623` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-trim-newlines - 3.0.0+~3.0.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-trim-newlines package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.0+~3.0.0-1').
